title: Practice-Oriented Database Design and Implementation Workshop

context.prior_knowledge: Basic Database Theory and SQL Query Writing Experience
context.additional_context: Customized curriculum design emphasizing job relevance for current practitioners. Focuses on developing database design skills for scientific data processing

learning_goals: Design a relational database schema reflecting practical requirements.
Manage the database development process with team members using collaboration tools.
Experience the database development lifecycle from user needs analysis to prototyping and evaluation.
Implement search forms and query interfaces tailored to the characteristics of scientific domain data.
Apply methods to improve database performance through iterative testing.

resources: Collaborative Project Management Tools (Jira, Notion, etc.)

difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
